text: okay, it's now live in production and I'm not seeing it in the sitemap. The sitemap: <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/2062618/marketing/web-pages/all-domains/sitemaps> the dynamic page: <https://www.chargebackgurus.com/glossary> the hubdb table: <https://app.HubSpot.com/hubdb/2062618/table/679944>
okay I think i figured this out. It actually is in the sitemap.xml file - it's just not editable/viewable in the HubSpot sitemap tool that i linked to above
that makes sense since they are not actual pages. Also if you wants to block them you can add it into the robots.txt file.
When you do that it removes it from the sitemap
it should at the very least be stated on the page that's how it works. ideally, imo, they would work just like any other page in the sitemap tool
That is evry HubSpot documentation there is.

Does anyone have any experience setting contact values from HubDB? I’m working on a team directory with a contact form on each person’s profile page. It’d be great if I could set the HubSpot owner from a HubDB value instead of having to make 50+ forms.
Try using a hidden field and workflows?
I would do the same as chad mentioned here
would that be a workflow with 50 branches, or do you have something else in mind?
You can use the email from the field.
So the form that gets submitted sends an email to the email in the hidden field.
so a hidden field for HubSpot owner, and then send the email to the owner?
